column5: Decided to try our luck at Mountsberg today.  We caught a ton of pike and this beautiful largie.  He engulfed my buzzbait.  Didnt even have to set the hook.  Not sure how big.  Im guessing about 4 lbs maybe more.  Its hard to believe that this little body of water has so many fish in it.  Its always a good day there.  Enjoy.
great big fish!  that is a nice surprise from mountsberg  Cheers!
Nice largie pd4. What's the weed situation at the berg right now? I imagine the water levels are better than usual for this time of year.

There are still lots of weeds but not as bad as earleier in the year.  The water is really high still.  The bass have lots of hiding places due to the high water.  They seem to be hanging tight to the shoreline in the slop because of the higher water levels.  In previous years weve caught bass all over the lake. This year it seems they are tucked away.  Just gotta find em.  Pike are everywhere though.
dont be surpirsed  mountsberg holds HUGe LMB  try to practice CPR in that lake so it will last for years
Very nice Largie!!!  Ya gotta love the Buzzbait bites!!!
Nice largie. I have caught a lot of big bass on a buzzbait. Great lure. Thanks for sharing.
Nice big bucket pokerdemon4  To me, top water action is #1 when it comes to bass fishing! Thanks for sharing Leechman
very nice catch!  i didn't think those mumma's existed in that water.   beautiful fish, thanks for sharing.
Beauty bucketmouth!! Can't beat the topwater bite, congrats and thanks for the report.  Cheers, 1leg
I've been itching to fish here forever... just having something that floats to fish in eludes me!
Great bass!  Must have been awesome having it smash a buzzbait!

Nice one!  I live in Carlisle and only discovered the Berg in the last month... been up there tonds of times in the canoe... catching tons of pike, perch, sunfish and one crappie.... can't seem to grab those largies!  any suggestion ou there?
Thats a really nice catch!  I have yet to catch a bass this season. i should really hit up a bass area.
Hit the slop and start pitching plastic creatures or gulp worms.  Don't forget your topwater baits too.  The water is really high.  The bass are hiding.
